author: The Editorial Board
title: Warren Democrats for Wall Street
text:
The Senate this week will debate a bipartisan bill that would relax some of the 2010 Dodd-Frank lawâ€™s blunderbuss regulations. Progressives are denouncing the modest reforms as gifts to Wall Street, though the irony is that Dodd-Frank has been a boon for the biggest banks.
Like ObamaCare, Dodd-Frank was a product of the Pelosi Congress and faith in the genius of central planners. The law enshrined too-big-to-fail while writing vague language that has led to hundreds of new rules, some measuring thousands of pages, that are... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
